Question Text: A 60 year old health care worker contracted a URTI while posted in the respiratory ICU. O/E febrile-102 F, Pulse-110/min, tachypnea, auscultation showed rhonchi and wheeze over the lung fields with features suggestive of ARDS. CXR showed ground glass opacities. The suspected pathogen is known to exhibit antigenic variation referred to as Shift & Drift.
Explain the sequence of events involved in the pathogenesis of Infection.
Discuss the Laboratory diagnosis of the agent associated with the clinical condition.
Discuss the Immunoprophylactic measures available to combat this condition.
The patient develops bacterial pneumonia during recovery. Give reason.

A 25 year old male presented with a painless ulcer on the external genitalia since 2 weeks. No h/o discharge/ burning micturition. H/o exposure with stranger 4 weeks back. O/E- a single, indurated ulcer on the glans penis. Non tender-bilateral inguinal lymphadenopathy seen.
Mention the bacterial agents causing Sexually transmitted infections.
Discuss the pathogenesis & the clinical sequelae if the infection is associated with the pathogen shown in the picture.
Mention the Specific Serological tests for the diagnosis & Explain any one in detail.
Neonates with Congenital syphilis may be asymptomatic at birth. Give reason.
